panels.description: Total time that system was up and running after reboot
panels.title: Up Time

panels.description: Removing the idle time percentage from 100 will give you the CPU utilization percentage  (Stat Graph)
panels.title: CPU Usage ($interval)

panels.description: Removing the idle time percentage from 100 will give you the CPU utilization percentage (Time series Graph)
panels.title: CPU Utilzation($interval)

panels.description: Amount of time the cpu spent on user applications
panels.title: CPU - User Mode($interval)

panels.description: Amount of time the CPU spent/ stayed idle
panels.title: CPU - Idle Mode($interval)

panels.description: Amount of time the CPU spent on Kernal related tasks
panels.title: CPU - System Mode($interval)

panels.description: iowait is time that the processor/processors are waiting
panels.title: CPU - IO Wait Mode ($interval)
CPU Usage, Memory Usage, Disk Usage ($interval)

targets.expr:
(
  (1 - sum without (mode) (rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{ mode=~"idle|iowait|steal"}[$__rate_interval])))
/ ignoring(cpu) group_left
  count without (cpu, mode) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"})
)
